sn35.180-182:0.3.eng: Desire, Etc. for the Suffering Exterior

sn35.180-182:1.1.pli: “Yaṃ, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ, tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
sn35.180-182:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, you should give up desire … greed … desire and greed for what is suffering.

sn35.180-182:1.3.pli: Rūpā, bhikkhave, dukkhā; tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.

sn35.180-182:1.8.pli: dhammā dukkhā; tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.

sn35.180-182:1.9.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ, tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo”ti.

sn35.183-185:0.3.eng: Desire, Etc. for the Not-Self Exterior

sn35.183-185:1.1.pli: “Yo, bhikkhave, anattā, tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
sn35.183-185:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, you should give up desire … greed … desire and greed for what is not-self.

sn35.183-185:1.3.pli: Rūpā, bhikkhave, anattā; tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.
sn35.183-185:1.3.eng: Sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and ideas are not-self …”

sn35.183-185:1.8.pli: dhammā anattā; tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo.

sn35.183-185:1.9.pli: Yo, bhikkhave, anattā tatra vo chando pahātabbo, rāgo pahātabbo, chandarāgo pahātabbo”ti.

sn35.186:0.3.eng: The Interior Was Impermanent in the Past

sn35.186:1.1.pli: “Cakkhu, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ atītaṃ …pe… jivhā aniccā atītā …pe… mano anicco atīto.
sn35.186:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the past the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind were impermanent.

sn35.186:1.2.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmimpi nibbindati …pe… jivhāyapi nibbindati …pe… manasmimpi nibbindati.
sn35.186:1.2.eng: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

sn35.186:1.3.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati; vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
sn35.186:1.3.eng: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.

sn35.186:1.4.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānātī”ti.
sn35.186:1.4.eng: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn35.187:0.3.eng: The Interior Will Be Impermanent in the Future

sn35.187:1.1.pli: “Cakkhu, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ anāgataṃ …pe… jivhā aniccā anāgatā …pe… mano anicco anāgato.
sn35.187:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the future the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind will be impermanent …”

sn35.188:0.3.eng: The Interior Is Impermanent in the Present

sn35.188:1.1.pli: “Cakkhu, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ paccuppannaṃ …pe… jivhā aniccā paccuppannā …pe… mano anicco paccuppanno.
sn35.188:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the present the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are impermanent …”

sn35.189-191:0.3.eng: The Interior as Suffering in the Three Times

sn35.189-191:1.1.pli: “Cakkhu, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ atītaṃ anāgataṃ paccuppannaṃ …pe… jivhā dukkhā atītā anāgatā paccuppannā …pe… mano dukkho atīto anāgato paccuppanno.
sn35.189-191:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the past … future … present the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are suffering …”

sn35.19:1.1.pli: “Yo, bhikkhave, cakkhuṃ abhinandati, dukkhaṃ so abhinandati.
sn35.19:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, if you take pleasure in the eye, you take pleasure in suffering.

sn35.19:1.2.pli: Yo dukkhaṃ abhinandati, ‘aparimutto so dukkhasmā’ti vadāmi.
sn35.19:1.2.eng: If you take pleasure in suffering, you’re not free from suffering, I say.

sn35.19:1.3.eng: If you take pleasure in the ear …

sn35.19:1.5.pli: yo jivhaṃ abhinandati, dukkhaṃ so abhinandati.

sn35.19:1.6.pli: Yo dukkhaṃ abhinandati, ‘aparimutto so dukkhasmā’ti vadāmi.

sn35.19:1.8.pli: yo manaṃ abhinandati, dukkhaṃ so abhinandati.
sn35.19:1.8.eng: mind, you take pleasure in suffering.

sn35.19:1.9.pli: Yo dukkhaṃ abhinandati, ‘aparimutto so dukkhasmā’ti vadāmi.
sn35.19:1.9.eng: If you take pleasure in suffering, you’re not free from suffering, I say.

sn35.19:2.1.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, cakkhuṃ nābhinandati, dukkhaṃ so nābhinandati.
sn35.19:2.1.eng: If you don’t take pleasure in the eye, you don’t take pleasure in suffering.

sn35.19:2.2.pli: Yo dukkhaṃ nābhinandati, ‘parimutto so dukkhasmā’ti vadāmi.
sn35.19:2.2.eng: If you don’t take pleasure in suffering, you’re free from suffering, I say.

sn35.19:2.3.eng: If you don’t take pleasure in the ear …

sn35.19:2.5.pli: yo jivhaṃ nābhinandati, dukkhaṃ so nābhinandati.

sn35.19:2.6.pli: Yo dukkhaṃ nābhinandati, ‘parimutto so dukkhasmā’ti vadāmi.

sn35.19:2.8.pli: yo manaṃ nābhinandati, dukkhaṃ so nābhinandati.
sn35.19:2.8.eng: mind, you don’t take pleasure in suffering.

sn35.19:2.9.pli: Yo dukkhaṃ nābhinandati, ‘aparimutto so dukkhasmā’ti vadāmi.”
sn35.19:2.9.eng: If you don’t take pleasure in suffering, you’re free from suffering, I say.”

sn35.192-194:0.3.eng: The Interior as Not-Self in the Three Times

sn35.192-194:1.1.pli: “Cakkhu, bhikkhave, anattā atītaṃ anāgataṃ paccuppannaṃ …pe… jivhā anattā …pe… mano anattā atīto anāgato paccuppanno.
sn35.192-194:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the past … future … present the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are not-self …”

sn35.195-197:0.3.eng: The Exterior as Impermanent in the Three Times

sn35.195-197:1.1.pli: “Rūpā, bhikkhave, aniccā atītā anāgatā paccuppannā. Saddā … gandhā … rasā … phoṭṭhabbā … dhammā aniccā atītā anāgatā paccuppannā.
sn35.195-197:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the past … future … present sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and ideas are impermanent …”

sn35.198-200:0.3.eng: The Exterior as Suffering in the Three Times

sn35.198-200:1.1.pli: “Rūpā, bhikkhave, dukkhā atītā anāgatā paccuppannā. Saddā … gandhā … rasā … phoṭṭhabbā … dhammā dukkhā atītā anāgatā paccuppannā.
sn35.198-200:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the past … future … present sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and ideas are suffering …”

sn35.2:1.3.pli: yadanattā taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.
sn35.2:1.3.eng: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’

sn35.2:1.10.pli: yadanattā taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.
sn35.2:1.10.eng: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’

sn35.2:1.12.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn35.20:1.1.pli: “Yo, bhikkhave, rūpe abhinandati, dukkhaṃ so abhinandati.
sn35.20:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, if you take pleasure in sights, you take pleasure in suffering.

sn35.20:1.2.pli: Yo dukkhaṃ abhinandati, ‘aparimutto so dukkhasmā’ti vadāmi.
sn35.20:1.2.eng: If you take pleasure in suffering, you’re not free from suffering, I say. …”

sn35.20:1.8.pli: Yo dukkhaṃ abhinandati, ‘aparimutto so dukkhasmā’ti vadāmi.

sn35.20:2.1.pli: “Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, rūpe nābhinandati, dukkhaṃ so nābhinandati.

sn35.20:2.2.pli: Yo dukkhaṃ nābhinandati, ‘aparimutto so dukkhasmā’ti vadāmi.

sn35.20:2.8.pli: Yo dukkhaṃ nābhinandati, ‘aparimutto so dukkhasmā’ti vadāmi.”

sn35.201-203:0.3.eng: The Exterior as Not-Self in the Three Times

sn35.201-203:1.1.pli: “Rūpā, bhikkhave, anattā atītā anāgatā paccuppannā. Saddā … gandhā … rasā … phoṭṭhabbā … dhammā anattā atītā anāgatā paccuppannā.
sn35.201-203:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the past … future … present sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and ideas are not-self …”

sn35.204:0.3.eng: The Interior and What’s Impermanent in the Past

sn35.204:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the past the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind were impermanent.

sn35.204:1.4.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ …pe…
sn35.204:1.4.eng: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’ …”

sn35.204:1.8.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ …pe…

sn35.204:1.12.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.

sn35.205:0.3.eng: The Interior and What’s Impermanent in the Future

sn35.205:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the future the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind will be impermanent.

sn35.205:1.4.pli: Yadanattā taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ …pe…

sn35.205:1.8.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ …pe…

sn35.205:1.12.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.

sn35.206:0.3.eng: The Interior and What’s Impermanent in the Present

sn35.206:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the present the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are impermanent.

sn35.206:1.4.pli: Yadanattā taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ …pe…

sn35.206:1.8.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ …pe…

sn35.206:1.12.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.

sn35.207-209:0.3.eng: The Interior and What’s Suffering in the Three Times

sn35.207-209:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the past … future … present the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are suffering.

sn35.207-209:1.3.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ …pe…

sn35.207-209:1.7.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.

sn35.21:1.1.pli: “Yo, bhikkhave, cakkhussa uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṃ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.
sn35.21:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the arising, continuation, and manifestation and regeneration of the eye is the arising of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the manifestation of old age and death.

sn35.21:1.2.eng: The arising, continuation, and manifestation and regeneration of the ear …

sn35.21:1.6.pli: yo manassa uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṃ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.
sn35.21:1.6.eng: and mind is the arising of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the manifestation of old age and death.

sn35.21:2.1.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, cakkhussa nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṃ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo.
sn35.21:2.1.eng: The cessation, settling, and disappearance of the eye is the cessation of suffering, the settling of diseases, and the disappearance of old age and death.

sn35.21:2.2.eng: The cessation, settling, and ending of the ear,

sn35.21:2.6.pli: yo manassa nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṃ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo”ti.
sn35.21:2.6.eng: and mind is the cessation of suffering, the settling of diseases, and the disappearance of old age and death.”

sn35.210-212:0.3.eng: The Interior and What’s Not-Self in the Three Times

sn35.210-212:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the past … future … present the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are not-self.

sn35.210-212:1.2.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ …pe…
sn35.210-212:1.2.eng: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’ …”

sn35.210-212:1.5.pli: Yadanattā taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.

sn35.213-215:0.3.eng: The Exterior and What’s Impermanent in the Three Times

sn35.213-215:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the past … future … present sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and ideas are impermanent.

sn35.213-215:1.4.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.

sn35.213-215:1.12.pli: Yadanattā taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.

sn35.216-218:0.3.eng: The Exterior and What’s Suffering in the Three Times

sn35.216-218:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the past … future … present sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and ideas are suffering.

sn35.216-218:1.3.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.

sn35.216-218:1.10.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.

sn35.219-221:0.3.eng: The Exterior and What’s Not-Self in the Three Times

sn35.219-221:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, in the past … future … present sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and ideas are not-self.

sn35.219-221:1.2.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.
sn35.219-221:1.2.eng: And what’s not-self should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’ …”

sn35.219-221:1.8.pli: Yadanattā, taṃ ‘netaṃ mama, nesohamasmi, na meso attā’ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ.

sn35.22:1.1.pli: “Yo, bhikkhave, rūpānaṃ uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṃ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.
sn35.22:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the arising, continuation, and manifestation and regeneration of sights is the arising of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the manifestation of old age and death.

sn35.22:1.2.eng: The arising, continuation, and manifestation and regeneration of sounds,

sn35.22:1.6.pli: yo dhammānaṃ uppādo ṭhiti abhinibbatti pātubhāvo, dukkhasseso uppādo, rogānaṃ ṭhiti, jarāmaraṇassa pātubhāvo.
sn35.22:1.6.eng: and ideas is the arising of suffering, the continuation of diseases, and the manifestation of old age and death.

sn35.22:2.1.pli: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, rūpānaṃ nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṃ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo.
sn35.22:2.1.eng: The cessation, settling, and ending of sights,

sn35.22:2.6.pli: yo dhammānaṃ nirodho vūpasamo atthaṅgamo, dukkhasseso nirodho, rogānaṃ vūpasamo, jarāmaraṇassa atthaṅgamo”ti.
sn35.22:2.6.eng: and ideas is the cessation of suffering, the settling of diseases, and the disappearance of old age and death.”

sn35.222:1.1.pli: “Cakkhu, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ …pe… jivhā aniccā …pe… mano anicco.
sn35.222:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are impermanent.

sn35.222:1.3.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn35.223:1.1.pli: “Cakkhu, bhikkhave, dukkhaṃ …pe… jivhā dukkhā …pe… mano dukkho.
sn35.223:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are suffering.

sn35.223:1.3.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn35.224:1.1.pli: “Cakkhu, bhikkhave, anattā …pe… jivhā anattā …pe… mano anattā.
sn35.224:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are not-self.

sn35.224:1.3.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn35.225:1.1.pli: “Rūpā, bhikkhave, aniccā. Saddā … gandhā … rasā … phoṭṭhabbā … dhammā aniccā.
sn35.225:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and ideas are impermanent.

sn35.225:1.3.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn35.226:1.1.pli: “Rūpā, bhikkhave, dukkhā. Saddā … gandhā … rasā … phoṭṭhabbā … dhammā dukkhā.
sn35.226:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and ideas are suffering.

sn35.226:1.3.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn35.227:1.1.pli: “Rūpā, bhikkhave, anattā. Saddā … gandhā … rasā … phoṭṭhabbā … dhammā anattā.
sn35.227:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and ideas are not-self.

sn35.227:1.3.eng: They understand: ‘… there is nothing further for this place.’”
